Reviews.Title: “A great choice, website doesn't do it justice!”
Reviews.Author: Stella3000
Reviews.Content: I would definitely stay here again. The room was spacious, decorated as in the photo, which is much prettier in person. Originally booked the superior, but last minute we upgraded to deluxe (was night of our wedding). Included a tea kettle, a split of champagne, and chocolates. The little balcony was a nice plus even though we couldn't sit on it, it was quite lovely overall! We were permitted a one hour delay in our check out. The hotel bar was very luxurious feeling. The barman was very accomodating, a simple coffee order was accompanied by beautiful service pieces, chocolates, and fresh fruit. wish we didn't sleep so late so we could have enjoyed the room and hotel more! The street is quiet, very close to great locations. Stop at Madeline 7 cafe ( beautiful, very good food)!

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in the centre of Paris”
Reviews.Author: eatyourgreens
Reviews.Content: A quiet oasis in the hubbub of central Paris with a knowledgeable and courteous staff, clean and nicely decorated rooms and a properly French ambience. Easy to get everywhere via walking, Metro or taxi. We booked inclusive of Eurostar so it was a real bargain for the quality of everything. We didn't eat in the hotel although the restaurant looked to be not bad value compared with other places we visited. Our only quibble was that the room was a bit overheated but maybe that's coming from women "d'un age certain" ?! The bar is expensive but smart and, again, good service. I would thoroughly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Mon Cherie”
Reviews.Author: passiveagressive
Reviews.Content: A quaint hotel on a quiet street that was totally adequate but nothing too fancy.We had a very typical view of the rooftops of Paris as we were on the 5th floor and I am sure I have seen a similar view in a painting somewhere in my travels.The property is tucked away and a little hard to find at first but as it turned out not a bad location once one got oriented.Our room was small and could soon use some refurbishing as it looked to be well used but it did have charm,and passed the travel weary(and frigid) critique of my faithful companion Madame Sherry!The weather was a little cool for her tastes in January but the bed was comfortable and the room warm and clean.It looked as though the hotel had a fairly strong following of repeat guests which is a very good sign and I suppose it offers good value for its location.The restaurant was magnifique and they had a hearty breakfast buffet to get you started.All in all a good choice though next time we will stay near the Latin quarter a little closer to the action!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel for a traditional Parisien experience”
Reviews.Author: Chris N
Reviews.Content: Great location, very quiet but still only a 10 minutes' walk from the Champs Elysees and 5 minutes from the Mironmesnil, Saint Augustin or Madeleine metros - very easy to get to all the main sight-seeing places from the hotel ~ we walked to most places. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful - concierge, reception, restaurant, maids. Our ("superior") room seemed a little small at first, but it was very comfortably furnished and decorated, and was kept immaculately clean during our stay. The breakfasts are all you could want to start the day - cereals, fruit juices, yoghurts, fresh and dried fruit, fruit salad, a wide selection of bread, rolls, pastries, etc. A hot choice can be made from bacon, sausage, eggs, mushrooms, tomatoes and there is a cold table of various cooked meats and cheeses. The dining room staff were exceptionally attentive to detail and ensured we could have all we wanted to eat. We also ate 2 evening dinners (one on Valentine's night) in the hotel and the food then was second to none for quality and presentation. Overall, we thought the food was exceptionally good. The gym is a little small with a few machines, but quite honestly, if you want exercise do what the Parisiens do and go out for a run on the Champs Elysees or in the Tuileries Gardens - both just a 5 minute jog from the hotel. There are some bars and restaurants nearby, but you have to walk out further to get a greater selection. We feel as if we have stayed in a very traditional Parisien hotel that went out of its way to make our experience of the city very comfortable and enjoyable. We would definitely return there ourselves and recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: Small but nice rooms. Pretty friendly staff. Great location to the many things, , resturants and transportation, Train, bus etc. internet service very expensive gym very small room very very clean but too small very good atention from clerks elevator to old

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and service”
Reviews.Author: smth78
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel during a 4 day trip in Paris. This is my 4th stay in the hotel. We were upgraded to a newly renovated junior suite on this trip. Good size rooms and bathrooms. Fantastic gem located near the metro, shops and restaurants. Unfailingly helpful staff particularly the concierge who helped with restaurant confirmations and organizing trips outside the city. There is a monoprix located down the street where you can get some provisions.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms - unusally large”
Reviews.Author: cas2814
Reviews.Content: The Astor is a real find in Paris. A hotel that is clean and bright with large rooms and super bathrooms in the de luxe category The breakfast was acceptable and the bar was lively. The position is central and perfect for the department stores, restaurants and sights. Highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “I will definately stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: islandesa
Reviews.Content: I just came home from a 4 days trip to Paris and I must recommend this fantastic hotel. All the staff is excellent,the interior is beautiful and I highly recommend a dinner adventure at the restaurant. We had extraordinary good food with selection of the best wines we tasted in PAris for only 80 euros pr. person.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel in excellent position”
Reviews.Author: DMMDorset
Reviews.Content: This was a good hotel close to the Madeleine, just behind the Faubourg St Honore and a short walk from the Boulevard Hausmann and all the shops. Also within walking distance of some excellent restaurants. We were fortunate to have a suite which was very spacious and extremely comfortable if a little tired decoratively. The front of house staff were very friendly and could not do enough to help. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel for reasonable price in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: robtroxel
Reviews.Content: Thanks to all of the earlier reviewers for helping us find this Gem! It is located not far from Gare St Lazare and the Opera on a quieter street. The theme is Parisian in look and execution with lots of mirrors and gold guilding. Rooms are small but not bad for Paris. Try for an inside room. We were amazed at the sound control. Rooms were decorated with fabric on the walls. Windows are double glazed! The breakfast buffet was set in a beautiful dining room and well presented with many food choices. Staff is also great to work with. Seek out Dennis , the Concerge. He is a real asset! Thru him, We learned is is a 15 minute walk to catch the airport Roissy Bus by the Opera. This saved us a huge amount of money>>instead of taking a cab to the airport! We look forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent, comfortable, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: kiropraktor
Reviews.Content: Complete staff is nice, pleasent and helpfull in any required way. Room was spacious and very comfortable - de lux with king size bed, and bathroom nice,spacious and clean. Perfect location, meaning close to almost everything.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice French boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JoanthonyK
Reviews.Content: Great location, large room ( I booked a king room), very clean with good service. The concierge was alittle snobby, but it's Paris!

Reviews.Title: “john guest”
Reviews.Author: johng555
Reviews.Content: Central but very quiet location just around the corner from presidential palace. The room was small but this is Paris.Reception staff helpful and polite Concierge brilliant all the help you want with anything. We did not eat dinner but breakfasts excellent. Monoprix for your snacks and drinks close by, turn left out of the hotel and its on your right at the end of Rue d'astorg. The air conditioning is not brilliant but it is quiet and opening the windows cooled the room down.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem within walking distance to key attractions!”
Reviews.Author: KwanStella
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I got this hotel at last minute.com and we didn't know what to expect. We heard bat the reviews but were unsure as this is our first to Paris. However, this hotel surprises us! We open our doors to a complimentary of champagne as it is our second honey moon! Rooms were in romantic colors! Beds were great ! Toilets too! They have a few elevators which cuts down time waiting. Ours is just next to it in a quiet corner. Next is the location. It's great! It's walking distance to saint augustin and Madeline metro which are two important one that leads us to the Eiffel, lourve, champs elyess. But the best part, we can walk to all these places. I love the fact that it is only 5 mins to saint honore where I can buy my prada , louis vuitton, longchamp and take a bite at the famous lauduree macorons and we had it two days. Best of my all, my hubby loves Chinese food and they have 4 restaurants just round the corner and a supermarket just next to it. What can I say? They have got the best in everything.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the action”
Reviews.Author: DEBBIE51
Reviews.Content: Great location. Had room 711 OCt 15-22. Superior room. Great concierge. Couple blocks from presidential palace. Great breakfast. Easy to walk to champs d'elysees. Free wifi with passwords. Monoprix two blocks away to buy wine and snacks

Reviews.Title: “somewhat disappointing”
Reviews.Author: jocar99
Reviews.Content: We had a lackluster greeting at the front desk and had to leave an extra deposit of 150 euros in case we use something beyond the hotel expenses. This was not the procedure of any other hotel that we had stayed in. After showing us our superior room, we asked to be upgraded to a Delux room . Phillipe, the manager found us a delux room with much more space with a better view of the city .The linens were of better quality, however with the same tiny bathroom. He graciously sent a bottle of champagne to our room to make sure our stay would be a good one, which was such a nice gesture and greatly appreciated. The AC had to be utilized since it was very hot in Paris at the time. After inspecting the AC exhaust unit above on the ceiling, I could see that the wallpaper and moulding were covered in black mould from the unit. I did report this to the reception desk and on my comment report. Breakfast was in a beautiful dining room where the man in charge was visable at all times making sure everything was attended to. The bartender was very slow and ignored us for about 20 minutes until I brought to his attention that we had been waiting a long time! There was a TV on in the lobby non stop from the minute we checked in until we left. The hotel is also on a very quiet and narrow street , making the entrance dark a not so cheerful. At checkout, mistakes were made on my account and had to be corrected A nice hotel, but not a great one .I had the feeling that nobody really loved their jobs here, like they did in other places that I stayed in France.I probably will not stay here again the next time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect 4 days in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Fornoeyd
Reviews.Content: Can not find anything wrong with this hotel , every staff we met were smiling and welcoming (unfortunately some people in our party met one not so friendly receptionist) , the breakfast was amazing , location perfect in a quiet street close to everything! The room was a bit small , but when in Paris you don't use the room for anything but to sleep:) Can recommend this to everyone , will stay here if I have another trip to Paris

Reviews.Title: “Great location, charming hotel, but TINY rooms.”
Reviews.Author: dgordon11
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our one night stay at this hotel. The lobby is lovely, the bar, intimate and friendly, the breakfast buffet was very good, The rooms were immaculate and charming, but small even by Euro standards. For the price paid we were surprised. I would say the dimensions were @ 9x9. No kidding. Double bed, which was fine for one night, but I would have gone insane for a week. No place for clothing, stepping over suitcases. the bathroom was equally tiny, with a shower only, but it was clean, well lit and the water pressure was great! :) Nice huge fluffy towels. Our room had a lovely courtyard view.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Yulia D
Reviews.Content: We staied in this hotel only for 3 day, but i got a great impression from it. The stuff is so nice and kind, that you can feel yourself like at home. Rooms are big and very comfortable. Tasty breakfasts. Also one can reach center of Paris slowly walking within 15 minutes. Next time in paris i will try to book the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault this Hotel ....”
Reviews.Author: Rose C
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Hotel after a week in London and after reading the mix of reviews on this website was a little apprehensive as I had booked the Hotel myself, but wasa more than happy by everything. Our room was small but more than adequate and the bathroom was a bonus being quite large. The concierge was the best - recommended three of the best restaurants within walking distance of the Hotel: Garner (seafood), Auberge St Roch (beef - best by far) and a wonderful french bistro called Salladais (I think). We could walk to just about everything from this Hotel - who needed the Metro or a bus? Unless you have young kids or babies. Couldn't recomend this Hotel highly enough - thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “Room with a broken bed and stopped sink”
Reviews.Author: stentdoc
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 2 nights at the end of a 18 night trip across Europe. We reserved a junior suite for me and my wife and 2 kids. We arrived in the room at 10 pm after flying from Budapest. The sofa bed was broken in the middle and no linen was in the room for the sofa bed when we used the bathroom the sink was clogged. I complained and the staff was helpful. They moved us to a new room but I had to move my 4 suitcases by myself as well as my 2 kids. The new room had no linen again and required a large amount of strength to flush the toilet. By this time iy was midnight so we went to sleep The next day I complained to the front desk and they told me the manager would call me. He never did. After coming back to the USA I emailed him again without a response The staff and location was good. This left me with a bad impression!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel After Poor Start”
Reviews.Author: SilverfoxMoscow
Reviews.Content: Having called to arrange a cot for our baby we arrived to find there were none available and the room we were given was quite small. In the morning we complained to the manager and were upgraded to a beautiful room with a large terrace and fantastic views. They also gave us a bottle of champagne and a gift for the baby which was very sweet. The location is excellent and the breakfast is very good. The concierge has got to be one of the best I've ever run across, a minefield of useful information and helpful tips. If you're looking for traditional style in the heart of Paris we warmly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Air conditioning doesn't work, no iron in room, lost our meeting room reservation, and completely ambivalent desk staff”
Reviews.Author: Brian O
Reviews.Content: Amazing. A business hotel with no iron in room, and a waiting list to get one in the morning, hot stuffy room with broken air conditioning and no one to fix it, mysteriously cancelled our conference room for a meeting today, and put us in a closet-sized sleeping room with a table as a substitute, and a front desk night manager who seems completely unconcerned about customer service. I would never stay here again - pathetic and embarrassing.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a quiet Parisian neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: jaw63102
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a quiet Parisian neighborhood. It's a 10-minute walk to the Champs E'leysses. A few brasseries are nearby but the neighborhood isn't very busy. It's nice to retreat here from the crowds of tourists you encounter at every turn in Paris. Staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast had variety and was good. The hotel is three-blocks to the Metro. It's a 15-minute ride and one to two connections on the Metro to most tourist sites like The Eiffel Tower, Champs Elysees, and The Louvre - up to three connections to the Marais District, Notre Dame and St. Germain District.

Reviews.Title: “Worked for us”
Reviews.Author: World_Class_Guru
Reviews.Content: The Astor is a nice, older, small hotel- close to nothing, but central to everything. If you enjoy walking to attractions, getting off the busy streets at night, and want friendly service, a clean room and a hot breakfast, then I would recommend you stay here. I would rate the hotel in more of a 4.0 star range, as the building is showing age, the air conditioning is slow to cool the room, and the hot water tanks do run out of hot water in the late morning. Overall, we spend very little time in our room and the location worked well for us.

Reviews.Title: “Always stay here when in Paris - love it!”
Reviews.Author: Irena W
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed overnight for a brief trip to Paris although I usually stay here with my mother for shopping before Christmas. As usual, the staff were friendly and polite and hotel was beautifully presented. I always enjoy the generous breakfast served although do feel the tea and coffee could arrive with a little more speed! The cocktails in the bar are particularly delicious and something I always look forward to. This hotel is in a superb location for the main shopping areas and is very easy to get to. Thoroughly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: LSU555
Reviews.Content: Great location - Close to the Metro - Very clean and well appointed rooms - Really fantastic service and staff (especially the concierge staff who got thing done with a phone call) - Reasonable priced and I would stay here again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic service and quality for a great value”
Reviews.Author: greg t
Reviews.Content: 1. Great central/north location, only 1-2 blocks to bus/taxi/metro. 2. Excellent breakfast value. 3. Very clean, nicely detailed rooms, lighting at night a little poor for reading, but who reads at night in Paris. 4. Above all, fantastic service, staff, friendly, conciere knows where everything is, etc. 5. When I come to Paris again, I will stay here, great value for your money. 6. St. Augustine just a block North, with brasserie (St. Augustine). Best creme brulee We have ever had. reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “We couldn't have asked for better”
Reviews.Author: CocoNuts359
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews of Paris hotels 'til I could barely focus, I chose the Astor Saint-Honore because it was in a package deal with American Airlines. I was a little apprehensive, but the hotel was fantastic. It's on a quiet street, just off two main boulevards, close to two Metro lines and several good little cafes and restaurants. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly, and spoke excellent English. We had breakfast in the room every morning for no extra charge, and the food was excellent. I was expecting a small room based on all the reviews I'd seen, but this was perfectly comfortable, and the furnishings were lovely. I especially liked the French doors opening over the courtyard, because we could sleep with windows open and not be bothered by street noise. We preferred that to air conditioning. The bathroom was modern and well-appointed. Yes, some rugs on the stairs are a little worn, but they were clean. All in all, it was the perfect place for a pre-college mother-daughter bonding trip. Both teenage daughter and mom loved this wonderful home base for our adventures.

Reviews.Title: “Our second stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Haddenham
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Astor which is situated in a great spot about a 10 walk from the Rue De Rivoli and a 15 minute walk from the Champs Elysee and also within about 5 minutes walk of two Metro stations and a bus line - both of which we used extensively. This 4 star Hotel is really lovely and the service was very good. We had booked a Deluxe Room for four nights but when we arrived we were allocated a Superior Room (one grade below) which was still pretty good but not what we had booked. The Hotel Manager was extremely apologetic and seemed almost mortified that there had been a mistake. Unfortunately, there were no Superior rooms available so as a 'compromise' he asked us to stay in the Superior room for two nights and then we would be upgraded to an Executive Suite for the remaining two nights! So, that's what we agreed to and on arrival in the Suite we found we had two full size balconies overlooking the Paris skyline with the Sacre Couer directly infront a few miles away and there was a free half bottle of Champagne as a personal apology from the Manager waiting for us when we got back that evening. The Hotel also relocated all our luggage from the Superior room to the Suite whilst we were out, so all in all a very satisfactory outcome to say the least1 The Hotel staff are very helpful throughout our stay and the service is extremely good, particularly the Concierge service. On checkout we noticed that our bill was overcharged by 38 euro for a breakfast that we hadn't had and it took a few minutes to sort that out but that was the only other very slight hiccup in the 4 nights and 5 days that we were at the Hotel. I'd thoroughly recommend the Astor Hotel if you're looking to pay a bit more for a lovely central Hotel in Paris but still not top drawer prices.

Reviews.Title: “Would try someplace else- AM ReceptionDesk Nasty.”
Reviews.Author: DebJax
Reviews.Content: My first impression upon checking in at the Reception Desk is that they do not like Americans. The morning shift were snooty, and rude. We arrived at the hotel at 12 PM and were told to come back at 3 PM. Other guests got their rooms right away. we arrived back at 3:15 and only one of our rooms were ready. The other was not ready until after 4 PM. We asked for extra pillows, towels and hangers and it took three calls to get them. We asked the hotel if they could break a 20 Euro in o smaller bills and they claimed they had no change. We asked fora wake up call at 615 AM which never came. The restaurant they recommended for dinner was closed. Thankfully the evening concierge recommended another one that was delicious. The Elevator closest to our room did not work for two days. I had to suggest to them to put a sign up informing their guests, On a positive note: rooms are comfortable and large and clean- however it would be nice to have a clothes line in the bathroom. Matheau in the bar is a delight and we enjoyed eating there for two nights Bottom line- this hotel has real possibility , but the reception desk is so nasty that I would not want to come back. I felt every time I had a question that I was intruding. Breakfast is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very good (2nd time in the hotel)”
Reviews.Author: Shraga2
Reviews.Content: Hotel un a small street not new but very comfortable with all the facilities we needed. Excellent central location, walking distances to many attractions. Our room faced the inner garden and was very quiet. Staff very friendly and helping. We used the concierge a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: illinoistraveler
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through American Airlines. We chose the room with breakfast option. The breakfast was wonderful with hot and cold choices and pastries that melted in your mouth! We had asked for two beds which were then pushed together for a king. Beds were very comfortable and the inside corridor room was always very quiet. We found the staff to be extremely helpful and friendly, especially Denis, a concierge, and Liuba, at the reception desk. We would definitely stay here again! We felt that there was great value for the money we spent.

Reviews.Title: “great location and great hotel staff.”
Reviews.Author: Frank036
Reviews.Content: For my first time in Paris this hotel was ideal. The front desk staff , the conceirge, and the bartenders were all amazing and extremely professional. My only complaint is with regards to the breakfast staff (mostly girls) in the restaurant they could use a course in friendliness! The room is a little small but it seems those are the standards in Paris. The location is amazing and if you want to walk Paris then this hotel is for you. Take the breakfast option it's worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: passenger1978
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel, stayed here with my girlfriend. The service is ok, reception staff aren't overly friendly and the breakfast is a bit of a rip off, never had it but at Â£20 a person hopefully its champagne and caviar but I doubt it. The rooms are cute but on the small side, but clean and nicely decorated. We could hear the people upsatirs alot and some mornings was very irritating. If you don't mind using the metro is pretty central, if you do stay somehere else as its not really in the centre. All in all we enjoyed Paris and hardly spent any time there, we just used it as a place to crash and we liked travelling by the metro.Its next to a nice supermarket to get some cheap nibbles and anything you need. Not a bad place at all!!!

Reviews.Title: “tired, out of the way hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelEL
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the middle of nowhere. It is in need of redecorating/updating. The carpets are stained and frayed, paint is chipping, and VERY overpriced. The staff is very Parisian, not helpful. Breakfast buffet was a free for all, food was not replaced, and not a very good selection of choices. It was a 15 minute walk to get to the metro, and a very dark walk at night. When we go back, we will return to the St. Germain area that is much more lively, walkable, and good little restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Quiet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jolange1968
Reviews.Content: Love this little hotel as the staff is WONDERFUL. Denis, the Conceirge is fantastic as is the rest of the staff. The food is GOOD with traditional french service and not near as pricey as others unless you are interesed in a bristo. I call it shabby "chic", very clean however not new, but the beds for France are not bad!

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it used to be”
Reviews.Author: bestestmates
Reviews.Content: This is my 5th or 6th stay at the Astor and I have to say I don't think I'll be back. I stayed here a few times in 2008 and 2009 and really liked the service and quite luxe decor for a 4* hotel. I also liked the good room service menu. However I found that I sem to be getting asigned to smaller and smaller rooms and started using a different hotel for business until changin jobs and finding it on the list again! We are paying around 200 euro for a normal queen room but i have to say that I think this is really steep considering that you can only just fit two people in with luggage. Generally the hotel looks like it needs updating and whilst this isnt a deal breaker, there are other hotels for less money that are in better condition. I know it probably osts a lot to redecorate a whole hotel and they must wait until it's so bad they can't avoid it, but seriously...no one wants to see fraying carpet on all the stairs, plug sockets that are loose from the walls, shower heads that wont stay up, TV remotes missing, old TVs, safes with no instructions. None of these ruin a stay but they kinda make you feel silly for paying so much. I've stayed in some 2* hotels in Paris and they have been charmingly shabby with great service. I don't thnk I'll be coming back to the Astor because the service and rooms no longer really justify the 4* price. If they spent a bit on fixing some basics I'd be back for sure as it's in a great spot, in a gorgeous building.

Reviews.Title: “Better Places to Stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Ilovetravel365
Reviews.Content: We booked under a Secret Hotel scheme and were very excited after booking by the look of the hotel, as we were driving round France our night in Paris was our luxury night in a nice hotel. However, upon arrival we had been given a twin room and returned immediately to reception to change to the double room we had booked, the receptionist was surly and her english was poor and she told us there were no rooms with one bed except 'kingsize' and did not give us the option of upgrading either. She stated that we had already been upgraded and housekeeping could push the beds together...how romantic! When in the room I also noticed damp and mould behind the door which I really don't expect to find in a 4 star hotel. We paid a quarter of the price stated in the hotel room which is perhaps why she had such a bad attitude towards us. But we paid much more than I have ever paid for a hotel in Paris and I would rather have stayed in a 2 or 3 star hotel if they actually gave me a double room like I had asked for! The hotel is located very close to the tourist areas between Champs Elysees and Boulevard Haussman, not the most exciting area of Paris but it explains the high price. Also if you are driving, the hotel has it's own carpark service at 30 euros a night but we parked on the street directly infront of the hotel for free! Overall I wasn't blown away with the service or the decor of the hotel, much nicer places to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Stay for the location and not the service”
Reviews.Author: leslie12
Reviews.Content: Pros: Good location for walking to all the main tourist sites. Reasonable price for a Paris hotel. Cons: Concierge was extremely rude - we went to ask a quick question right at 11pm and was told to come back the next day ...... guess they don't get paid overtime for 30 seconds. Rooms are quite small and outdated. We're stayed in hotels all over the world and we would not return on account of the bad service.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel In Prime Location”
Reviews.Author: MKB1701
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through American Airlines, and we were very happy with our stay here. The staff is friendly and speaks English, and, though on a side street, the Astor is centrally located in one of the finer neighborhoods in Paris, with Metro stops close by and a 15 minute walk to the Louvre and the Champs-Elysees. Even better, a Monoprix and an excellent bakery are close by. The size of our room was fine by European standards, nicely appointed with powerful AC. The bed sagged a bit by the ends, and there were only 3 pillows, which we found odd. All of the staff were remarkably helpful with the exception of the main concierge of all people. When I asked him for a reasonably priced restaurant (30 euros an entree) in the neighborhood, he replied, "well, there is an cafe where you can get a Caesar salad, or steak frites (that's a steak with fries) or a French onion soup up the block." He was perfectly nice about it, but I found the condescension a bit off-putting. Aside from this and the bed, though, our stay was pristine through and through. All and all, it was a great hotel, and we'd definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: triper_80
Reviews.Content: Rooms are not spacious but they are not small. The bed is vrey comfortable. Very clean. Not a single noise heard from the outside. Breakfast awesome. Very well located next to Les Champs Elysees and luxury streets.

Reviews.Title: “No hot water”
Reviews.Author: barbphillips75
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a convenient location. The rooms were small but adequate. The water in the bath was only luke warm at best in the morning. When I asked at the desk, they said that there had been an accident that affected the area including the hotel. There was hot water that night but again no hot water the next morning. By 10am the hot water was back. Seems that the water just runs out at peak shower times (7-9am). So if you're an evening shower person you'll be fine, but otherwise I would go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maxime2
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel through Tripadvisor and was not disappointed. It is perfectly situated, right in the centre of Paris, but on a quiet side street. We were given a lovely large room, which is not the norm in Paris. Our rate included breakfast, which is a must as breakfast is very expensive in Paris. The bed was extremely comfortable. We enjoyed a superb breakfast in bed every day and were very kindly not charged for this facility. The staff were extremely courteous and helpful and the hotel has a lovely intimate atmosphere. When in Paris again, we would definitely stay here. A tip, we purchased the Carte Viste before leaving the airport which gives you unlimited transport around Paris and to and from the airport, check it out. Also the Rouissy bus transfer is an excellent service to Paris from CDG airport, particularly if you have luggage as it would not be easy hauling your luggage up and down steps on the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: syaad
Reviews.Content: This is our second hotel in Paris for our honeymoon, Our room is My husband requested flower petals to be scattered on the bed. Instead, they surprised us by upgrading our room, free champagne and chocolate. I was amazed and could not ask for more. Room is huge by paris hotel standard. The hotel smell is nicely scented. Location is perfect with attractions nearby. It's so near to shopping districts. Those who loves shopping with designer item could benefit from this hotel. Would come here again.

Reviews.Title: “4* hotel with 2* service”
Reviews.Author: dutchmike82
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location but that is about it. Service was poor, on one occasion it took an hour to get an ice bucket and the following evening half an hour for a corkscrew. When I asked if I could have an iron and ironing board I was told they do not have any. Which for a 4* star hotel in my opinion is not good enough. The room itself was tiny which is understandable for a hotel in the centre of Paris however felt like a sauna. When I asked if someone could look at the A/C, I was told there was not anything that could be done about it and to open a window instead. There are so many places to choose from in Paris, I would definitely avoid this one in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A great base to explore Paris”
Reviews.Author: ben97
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel in a great location (albeit a little difficult to find at first). Staff very helpful and very polite. Lots of choice at breakfast (until 10am during the week and 11am on the weekend). Would definitely stay again. PS if you visit Paris you must go to the Musee d'Orsay. A brilliant gallery/museum in a fabulous old railway station.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible First Time visit to Paris”
Reviews.Author: ynotciti
Reviews.Content: Hotel Staff was completely helpful and very respectful. Hotel is about one block away from major street and 2 block walk from metro. We were upgraded from a classic room to Superior and given free breakfast every day. Free Wi-fi a must for staying in touch. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: Linworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a couple of times and they always seem to remember you, which is a nice feeling in a large city. The first room they gave me was a little tired looking. I asked to be moved to another and it was not a problem . They did it with a smile. Location is great . Breakfast & a welcoming staff is what bings me back. Dennis and his concierge staff do a wonderfull job in full filling any request. They even located a camera we left behind in a cab. That is pretty amazing this day and age.

Reviews.Title: “Good standard - a little old fashioned”
Reviews.Author: JollyJR
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rated as 4* and it tries to be so. The service and staff were very friendly and helpful , the breakfast buffet was good and the bar prices were definatley 4* ! The hotel decor is very dated and a bit stuck in the 1970's , however it was very clean. I would personally rate the hotel as 3*plus . We do enjoy walking and were able to walk to the Louvre , Eiffel Tower and many of the other attractions and shopping areas. Easy access to the metro which was only 5 minutes away. A major plus was the location was in a very quiet street.

Reviews.Title: “Location & Service”
Reviews.Author: david3b
Reviews.Content: The room was typical in size for french hotels, but the staff were far better than I have come to expect in recent years. The location could not be bettered, a quiet street, but a short walk from the Opera, Louvre and Arc de Triumph. Metro only minutes away and the Roissybus from CDG drops you close by.

Reviews.Title: “Considerate and Caring Staff and Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: MusicProfessor60
Reviews.Content: On a small, quiet street that ensures a restful night, this hotel provides adequate-sized rooms by Parisian standards. With a comfortable bed in a great location (near boutique shopping on the Rue Saint-Honore; close to the food havens of Fauchon and Hediard and the wonderful Laduree, La Maison du Chocolate, Jean-Paul Hevin; walking distance from Printemps and Galleries Lafayette to the east and the Champs Elysees to the west; and the sights of the Madeleine, the Opera Garnier, the Place de la Concorde and the Tuileries nearby), this fine hotel is distinguished even more for the care of the staff. My luggage did not arrive at the airport with me, and when I arrived at the hotel, they were in constant contact with the airport, giving me regular updates on the status of my luggage. No snootiness, just genuine and much appreciated consideration. Definitely on my list of possible Paris stays next time I'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Paris destination”
Reviews.Author: xSuperMotardx
Reviews.Content: Reasonably situated hotel, no wow factor but more than you need for a city break - comfortable, good breakfast, clean and friendly staff. To pay for more is a waste. Didnt try restaurant (other than breakfast) wanted to venture further. A little awkward to find on foot, need to remember route / bring a map!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean hotel, kind and supportive staff, great location, reasonably priced.”
Reviews.Author: DmitryVK
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the hotel before in the morning time, before 12. Staff was very kind and let us in the room earlier. Also, receptioninst guided through hotel and room facilities and lead us to the room. Room was big enough for 2 of us, clean and nicely decorated and very warm, bathroom was also well looked after and clean. Also, room had tea and coffe and a kettle, so we had cup of tea after long trip from London and able to have couple of hours of sleep before went to explore Paris for the first time. That was good start. Breakfast was exellent to our taste, big choice of food available, including selection fruits and vegetables, also english breakfast available with bacon and sausages for lovers of it. Hotel located in the almost centre, and we made our first trip to Louvre in about 15-20 min, not using public transport. There are plenty of places to eat and drink around the hotel, also famous Maxim just max. 15 min. away. Concierge team was very helpful with different matters, also adviced about local restaurant where we wanted to eat oysters and booked for us table. We used Hop on-Hop off sightseeing buses, so bus stop was also few min.away. This was very convenient as weather was too cold. Room cleaning staff was attending religiously our room probably few times a day to clean any mess we left or to make our beds again if we were resting during the day. This made us feeling that we were kindly looked after through all our stay. Thank you very much for the nice and professional hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Classy but overpriced and snotty service.”
Reviews.Author: claytoncast
Reviews.Content: I was booked in here by a client while working in Paris and I extended my stay for two nights for a break with my partner. the hotel is classy and looks good. Room(superior) small but nice, good facilities and very clean. Curtains didn't cover the window. free internet for 24 hours which is great but after that rip off starts at â‚¬17 per day. Staff helpful but a bit grand. One receptionist wouldn't give me a room service breakfast card and told me to ring down the following morning and order it. The concierge wanted me to sign for a â‚¬30 deposit for an umbrella when it was raining. Typical of the "we don;t trust you even as our guests" philosophy that I think runs this hotel. They just want your money. It;s not cheap, even on a corporate rate and i wouldn't stay there again

Reviews.Title: “The location was perfect and the room was large and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: lcolvill
Reviews.Content: I was extremely pleased with my room which was large and very comfortable and I was amazed at how quiet and peaceful it was at night even though the hotel is right in the centre of Paris and only a short distance from the Champs Elysee. I also found the staff very friendly and helpful and I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Low standards oh hygiene”
Reviews.Author: Craighp
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week and the bath was never cleaned. Above us they were moving furniture late at night. We asked for tea making facilities in the room and it never arrived. We asked 5 times to no result. The service was generally very poor and basic.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: omerhodes
Reviews.Content: Fantastic 3 night stay, very friendly staff, extremely helpful. Good base for exploring Paris, rooms were small but for the time spent in the room it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Marios72
Reviews.Content: Great location, great service, lovely rooms, friendly staff. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality if a little cramped. Excellent restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: Ian_T_D
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights as part of a package deal including Eurostar tickets. From the write up it appeared to be of higher quality than a standard stack of concrete boxes, which is what I wanted for a romantic getaway. The quality of fixtures and fittings lived up to this, but I was surpised at how small the room was. Especially as I'd paid extra to upgrade to a superior room (and I confirmed this was a superior room). There was only a couple of feet clearance each side of the bed, and maybe four foot at the end of the bed. The furniture consisted of a desk, wardobe and a small chair as there wasn't room for anything else. Even for a city hotel this was surprisingly small and I can't imagine what the standard room size is like! However, other than the size the standard was very nice and since we spent all our time out and about seeing the sites the size wasn't a problem for us. Everything was very clean and well maintained and it lived up to my expectations in all other areas. Special mention must go to the restaurant, which was excellent. We ate there on our first night as we didn't get in till 9:30. I was just expecting routine hotel fare, so decent but unspectacular. But the restaurnat is a proper hgh class desination, with excellent service and a fantastic menu. The kind of place I'd happily go to even if not staying there. Location was good as well. Five minute walk to the Champs Elysee, twenty to the Louvre and there's a Metro station round the corner. So it's an ideal base to work from as a tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Made our first visit to Paris a delight”
Reviews.Author: IraK48
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Paris and the Hotel Astor Saint-Honore helped make our vacation very memorable. Although the room was rather small, the friendliness and overall service of all staff made up for that. The location was great and we were able to walk to all the major tourist sites. The restaurant was delightful and the food quality was outstanding. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Paris

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but not the greatest for long stays”
Reviews.Author: mitc5502
Reviews.Content: If I were on vacation, I'd definitely stay at the Hotel Astor again...the rooms were immaculate, the staff was friendly and helpful, and the location is great if you plan to use the Metro a lot. However, if you're traveling for more than a few days, there are some potential drawbacks. Pros: -Breakfast is included and it is very good -Location-wise, the hotel is close to several Metro stops/lines, but not particularly close to any major sights. I like the flexibility of the Metro, so I prefer being close to that rather than being close to one particular sight. The neighborhood is very safe, with plenty of restaurants/cafes/shopping within easy walking distance. -There's a large grocery store (Monoprix, kinda like a downscaled French version of Target) less than a block away, which is nice if you want to pick up snacks -The rooms were very clean and the bed was plenty comfortable -Staff was nice and spoke English well enough to be helpful -I didn't book/pay for room (business travel) so I don't really know if the rooms are well-priced -Free wireless internet, if you have a laptop. If you're using a PDA/Smartphone for the internet, you'll have to pay, not matter what, which is a definite con. Cons: -My biggest complaint is that this hotel is not particularly good for long stays. I was stuck there for a month and it was kind of a pain. The mini-fridge is tiny and filled to the brim with mini-bar items, so it was difficult to store my own snacks/drinks in there. Also, the laundry prices were INSANE...literally about US $5 to get a pair of socks washed. If you stay longer than a few days, you're going to need to do laundry and the cost is prohibitive and there aren't a lot of laundromats in the area (the concierge laughed at me when I asked). I ended up doing laundry in the tub because I didn't want to blow my entire per diem just to wash my underwear. I expected a big markup, but the prices there blew me away. -I didn't really see any efforts by the hotel to be "green" in any way. Even when I left the "do not disturb" sign on the door, the maids still came in and changed the sheets and took the dirty towels, even though a towel used once does not need to be washed, IMO. Most hotels these days leave cards instructing guests to hang up towels that they plan to reuse to conserve resources (and cut costs), but no such program exists at the Hotel Astor...so if "green" is important to you, you'll have to take that into consideration. -The "free" internet suuuucks. Speed is capped at something like 128k/56k down/up, so if you plan to use Skype or telecommute, you'll find it very difficult...doable, but difficult. -If you're using a PDA or smartphone to get on the internet, you have to pay, and it was 9 Euro/24 hours, just for that. If you want to also get the faster data on your laptop, you have to pay separately for that, which was 18 euro a day or 70 euro a week (price is approximate, I don't remember what it was exactly). I realize that a lot of more expensive hotels charge for wireless, but if Motel 6 can offer free WiFi in a $39 room, why do I have to pay for it in a $300 room?

Reviews.Title: “Slipped A Bit”
Reviews.Author: BILLDC
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we stayed in this hotel. We were obviously very pleased with the hotel or we would not have booked again. Our room was very small compared to the previous trips. Hardly room to turn around. The small desk was half taken up with a CRT television (that's right, a CRT in 2010). The breakfast room which also is the hotel's restaurant needs to be updated, The furniture is old and really showing it's age. The arm of my chair was so wobbley it almost fell off. The breakfast was adequate but not up to the standard of our previous trips. We arrived at 2 PM and was told that our room wasn't ready. I asked if check-in time wasn't 2 PM she said no - it's 3 PM. When I showed her my reservation which said 2 PM she said again curtly that is 3 PM. Still, it's a nice hotel and if they update, I'd recommend with reservations

Reviews.Title: “Classic and classy...”
Reviews.Author: hafnarfjordur
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here with a small group for two nights. We had 3 rooms, all of them nice. The interior of the hotel is classic - lots of drapes, old looking furniture, really tasteful, cosy and classy...in contrast to the antique looking interior of the rooms and common rooms were the modern bathrooms which were also unusually large for Paris hotels. But mostly I must commend the staff though, which was abundant, multilingual, pleasant, friendly and helpful. The only negative I could mention which I experienced was the fact that there was only one small elevator which broke down at one point, which would have been difficult for people who are not able or who do not use stairs. ( there are at least 7 floors! ) Unfortunately, we were not able to eat at the restaurant (only open mon-fri) which is supposed to be excellent. We would love to return some day and absolutely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Safe and Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Singapore000
Reviews.Content: Located near embassy, safe Within walking distance of major shopping areas like Champs -Elysees, boutiques of St-Honore, Boulevard Haussmann, Printemps,Galeries L, Opera House Friendly concierge ever willing to provide assistance on direction with personal touch. Near metro and with cafes and supermarket at door step.

Reviews.Title: “Location!”
Reviews.Author: tickledpink88
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (2 adults and 2 teenagers) booked two rooms at this lovely, quaint hotel for two nights on our arrival in Europe and then another four nights before leaving to return to Canada. We were hoping the hotel would meet our expectations having booked it for two stays during our month in Europe. We were not disappointed! The location is fantastic. We walked everywhere...the Eiffel Tower, Musee D'Orsay, Sacre Coeur and Montemarte as well as the Louvre and gardens, the Madeleine, Gallerie Lafayette, Le Printemps, Champs Elysee, Notre Dame and much more. We walked to get dinner each night, walked to go shopping all over and basically saw the best of Paris directly from our hotel. This hotel is located close to the government buildings so it was very quiet on the weekends and into the evening. Since we were there in early August, a lot of Paris is shut down, including a lot of the restaurants, but with the help of the hotel's Concierge we were able to get a reservation at some very good restaurants within walking distance. Now, we don't mind walking....we walked about 6 hours each day, but we found we saw so much more. Paris is not dirty, quite the contrary...they clean the streets every morning. The food is really good and I really crave the baguettes with cheese and tomatoes that you can buy on the street corner. Make sure to have an ice cream cone from the stand across from the Gallerie Lafayette. It is a work of art as they make it into a flower! Take the bateau bus to see life along the Seine. We loved it even though we arrived into a heat wave in Europe (37 C each day when we arrived). Our hotel was quaint and lovely, just what you would expect from a Parisien hotel. We booked two rooms that were side by side (we asked for connecting although I don't believe they exist). They do not have two beds. The rooms are fairly small, but just fine for our stay. The decor was also very Parisien. The breakfast is expensive, but delicious. I still can taste the french pastries and baguettes. If you want a hotel close to all the attractions and don't mind walking, this is an ideal hotel. It is clean, comfortable and very convenient. The staff was efficient and attentive, particularly the Concierge Desk. They actually remembered our names each time we arrived or left the hotel. I would definitely stay here again...and will! We loved Paris!

Reviews.Title: “ooh la la”
Reviews.Author: katorcaz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the business end of town within easy walking distance of the Champs, the Madeleine and Printemps. The tour buses leave from the Madeleine which makes it very easy. There are a number of restaurants and patisseries nearby and also a Monoprix supermarket. The hotel is in a quiet street, is beautifully maintained, our room had an opening window onto a small courtyard, the staff are very helpful ... we don't speak French but it wasn't a problem as they had staff who could speak English very well. We were out so much we didn't eat dinner in the hotel and we preferred to go to the small patisseries nearby for breakfasts. Excellent small hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel with a fantastic...”
Reviews.Author: Colleen999
Reviews.Content: Lovely boutique hotel with a fantastic location. For the location alone I would return. Terrific hot/cold breakfast buffet and the dinner was great. A great find in Central Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good location- hard pressed to say it is a 4 star though”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELTHEWORLDLondon
Reviews.Content: Good points: Location good - easy to get to from the metro Room- good size Bellboy very pleasant. When ordering wine at the bar you get cheese instead of olivies. Bad points Reception staff not very friendly (though they were very pleasant to another guest who obviously had stayed there before) water in the bath did not flow well Poor service when i informed reception of broken safe in our room - no feedback from them at all. No ironing facilites available - unless you are willing to pay min of 7 euros per item. however the bath water did not drain properly and the decor was scruffy. In additon the safe did not work - and even though i informed the hotel reception, it was not fixed nor was there any feedback from reception. Make sure you take a travel iron unless you want to pay 7 Euros min to have a piece of clothing ironed.

Reviews.Title: “Well-managed hotel in a quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Wahoo71
Reviews.Content: We found the staff at the Astor Saint Honore to be especially competent and friendly. All were quite conversant in English, and the concierges were especially helpful. The guest rooms are tasteful and relatively large by Paris standards. The location is very quiet and, while it is not ideally located with respect to major tourist attractions, the neighborhood is very pleasant and the Louvre, etc., can be reached via a 20 minute walk or a short Metro ride. Finally, the breakfast buffet was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TerryMWarwickshire
Reviews.Content: I booked L'Astor after a lot of research and with some trepidation due to the mixed reviews. However, I was very impressed all round. The hotel is 10 mins walk (15 if you stroll) from Champs Elysees and a short taxi trip from most of the tourist attractions. OK, the area is a little iffy late at night (but tell me a big city where you don't have to have your wits about you), but the hotel was clean and staff very friendly and helpful. We went for a Deluxe Room (Euro 160 room only) which was large, well decorated and comfortable. I think that the Astor is an ideal base for a short stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Can you say an awesome two star hotel?”
Reviews.Author: KhooKongsi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good value if you consider it to be a 2 to 3 star hotel. But 4 Stars ...seriously? During our stay, we noticed that most of their guests are coming from Japanese tour groups. Evidently, the bulk of their business is from tour agencies -- hence the lack of effort from the hotel staff to court return customers. Breakfast was interesting, everyone around us were Japanese -- felt like we were in Tokyo not Paris! For us the stay was not pleasant. From the very beginning, they "insisted" on up-selling us an upgraded room. We politely said "no thank you" -- so they told us our room will be ready at 5 pm. We returned at 5 pm, and the hotel manager "insisted" on taking us on a tour of their upgraded room -- which by the way would have doubled the price of our room. The overall experience felt like a time-share promotion. The hair dryer did not work in the room. We overheard a guest asking for an iron and they told the guest to use their laundry service -- no iron, no ice bucket, no extra towels, nothing. This is pitiful. Granted we only payed US$110 for our room which included breakfast. So there was no point making a stink but I would not pay the rack rate for this "four star" hotel. Definitely NOT a Saint!

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: RenattoMadioz
Reviews.Content: This was the best accommodation of my last trip to Europe. The hotel is great. Not big, very nice in each deteail. The staff was very nice and the location is amazing... you can walk to the Champs Elysees...

Reviews.Title: “The service here is appalling. On the...”
Reviews.Author: Purplebasquiat
Reviews.Content: The service here is appalling. On the first day I asked to borrow a travel adaptor which the concierge lent me. On discovering that it didn't work I went down to the concierge who defensively said that it was bought just last week and it should work. Rather than exchange it there and then his attitude was that I couldn't be right and said he would send the technician over. The poos technician had to come to the room to confirm that it was indeed the adaptor and not the actual power point. What a bleeding waste of time. Their wifi connection is also another problem. A new password and login name is issued every day. I tried logging on and couldn't. Called the reception for a new password and again there was this defensive tone. The reception actually accused me of not doing it right in spite of the fact that I had repeated the right password. I am usually very patient but this was late at night and I needed to get access fast. Told the reception off and asked for his name and that jolted him enough to give me a new password. ALL that effort when they could have just assumed the simplest explanation and the issues would have solved themselves very quickly. Expensive for what it is, all things considered and even though location is fabulous there are other better establishments with none of the surliness. In fact check out the joker in the dining room with a face like sour prunes demanding your room number. It's like a Boys From Brazil club there. Trust me, better service and larger rooms elsewhere. I've given it two stars only for the location and cleanliness absolutely nothing else to commend.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful stay here -- a very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ianderson
Reviews.Content: My 17 year old daughter and I spent 4 nights here. Our room was beautiful and very comfortable. The staff provided excellent service. We loved the restaurant. Three metro stops are a few minutes walk away. There are lots of good cafes within a few blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: J_McCNorfolk
Reviews.Content: We managed to get a good deal our stay at this hotel through a third party website. The loaction is fantastic, down a quiet street but within easy walking distance of the St Augustin metro and a short enough walk to the Champs Elysees and other sights. The reception area is very welcoming and the bar is cozy. The room was small, but apparently most hotel rooms in Paris are like this. The bed did seem to be smaller than average but other than that, we had no prblems at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Ralakla
Reviews.Content: If you want to be within walking distance of the Arc d'Triumphe, the metro station, and shopping, then this is a great location. Very friendly and helpful staff at the concierge, reception and restaurant. Good value for money, given the high prices in Paris. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just go for the staff”
Reviews.Author: karayazgan
Reviews.Content: It's my 4th stay. The receptionist Andry has an elephant memory. He recalls all details about you.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile.”
Reviews.Author: Linworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: From check in at the front desk to people in the restaurant it was refreshing to see a smile on everyones face. The rooms are of nice size and kept tidy by the maid service. They even offer turn down service . The concierge was superb and arranged for some of our tours and reservations. The addition of the new beds make this a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great facilities.”
Reviews.Author: sophieChateauD_oex
Reviews.Content: Spacious reception area with excellent service from the valet parking "boys". They made sure the car was safely parked outside the hotel. The superior double room was comfortable with tea & coffee making facilities & we appreciated the full length bathtub after a hard day's shopping! The buffet breakfast was superb with a generous selection of hot & cold food, the restaurant staff were attentive & on hand with refills. This is a wonderful hotel which we will definitely use again.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel. Really Nice Hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: Escossia
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in September 2009. It was a really nice hotel. The main hotel lobby is beautiful and the hotel itself is in a really nice part of downtown with lovely shops / bars etc. From helpful and understanding check-in, through to Concierge, to Bar Staff and Restaurant Waiters, everyone gave us a first class and attentive service. The quality of the room was superb and with masses of space both in bedroom and bathroom. The bed itself WAS the biggest ever experienced in Paris (Super King). The room looked inwards to a quiet and private courtyard so the windows could be fully opened. Room had excellent Air-Con and also into bathroom. Breakfast service was comprehensive and with plenty of choice to suit every need. Do it once and experience the best that Paris has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for Paris”
Reviews.Author: PeterS51
Reviews.Content: Sinple, clean and efficient hotel in a good part of paris. manged to get a great internet rate for the hotel - so check on the net before booking.

Reviews.Title: “long weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: geedeebee
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a quiet area of Paris close to the Elysee Palace. Within easy walking distance of the Metro, Champs Elysee and Opera. Not right for those looking for local nightlife. Rooms a bit on the small side, we had a small room with big bathroom and our friends had a bigger room with a very small bathroom. Breakfast selection was good and plenty of it. We would probably stay nearer to the Latin Quarter next time to be nearer the restaurants and to avoid having to get the Metro back but that would not put us off staying in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Astor Saint Honore is to be recommended”
Reviews.Author: Froggy80
Reviews.Content: December, 2009: This is a wonderful hotel and we truly enjoyed our stay. The receptionist was efficient, the concierge knowledgeable, the bar was lovely and our rooms was clean and quiet. The hotel is located about 3 blocks away from Place de Madeline in the 8th. It is close enough to be convenient and far enough to be quiet. The neighborhood is a mix of day-time offices and residences. If you need a cab, the concierge has one there in a few short minutes. If you like the Metro, you have a couple of convenient choices; both safe and a short distance away, with connections to any lines you wish. Be sure to take the Full Board option, which includes your breakfast. The Astor's breakfast buffet is diverse, well stocked and delicious. From "creamy" French scrambled eggs to a good selection of French cheese. Our room was sufficiently spacious (no French hotel will give you the space of a Marriott or whatever your experiences are in America) when compared to many other hotels we have enjoyed over the years. We enjoyed our visit and highly recommend the Astor Saint Honore.

Reviews.Title: “Rather Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: imagine71
Reviews.Content: I can't really agree with many of the positive reviews here as I found the Astor rather disappointing - in my opinion more of a good 3 star hotel than the 4 stars it claims. Check-In was already slow and not very efficient but check-out was a nightmare. It took ages to get the invoice right - it seemed they were doing everyting for the first time. Not professional service in any way. Staff at breakfast and in the bar also seemed not really interested in what was going on around them - long waits and uninspired if not unfriendly. Especially breakfast was also on the very low quality side for the standard the hotel claims it has - hot items on the buffet were simply awful. The room I stayed in was supposed to be a superior room. I certainly don't want to know what a standard room would be like. This was was really small - even for Paris - with no space to even remotely think about working at the desk, which was not really an issue anyway as internet was not working and there was no electrical outlet anywhere near the desk. Staff suggested I pay for using the business center instead. The decor of the room though was nice but tired and worn. Everything very much on the older side - also the acceptable but not comfortable bed. One final service issue: they managed to forget the requested wakeup call in the morning - luckily I had a second alarm set. I may have been really unlucky in terms of the room I was given and the staff I encountered - but then again it still happened, so I would certainly neither return to the Astor nor recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Cute and comfy”
Reviews.Author: cortsie1982
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon last summer. It was rather comfortable but very pricey for the quality. Again traveling abroad is never cheap, so a four star hotel there will be around a three star here. The rooms are small but the ceilings are very high so they give a larger room feel. It was very Parisian and in a wonderful location. If you tend to be a very picky traveler, don't expect this place to be in tip top shape. It does the job but i'm sure there are better places to stay for the money. The breakfast is yum yum yum. Cant beat a good Paris breakfast. Staff was relatively friendly and very informative.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale hotel in quiet area”
Reviews.Author: Canadiantraveller095
Reviews.Content: We (4 ladies) stayed here 6 nights. Hotel is upscale and very nice. All but one staff member were wonderful and very helpful. Our two Deluxe Rooms were a good size and well maintained. Hotel is located in a quiet business area in e8 and is within easy walking distance to shopping, Metro stations, some restaurants, Champs d'Elysees, Palais Garnier. Breakfast buffet was fabulous. A few down sides. Despite booking 7 months ahead and requesting rooms on same floor, we ended up with rooms on two different floors. Not the end of the world, but definitely something the hotel should readily have been able to facilitate with so much notice. One computer with very expensive pay per use Internet service is available on ground floor. All in all, we liked the hotel itself very much and would definitely recommend it. But for myself, I would prefer to stay at a hotel a little further south of this one for a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place, great location”
Reviews.Author: dcist25
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely boutique hotel, very charming. The staff couldn't have been more attentive and helpful. It is very centrally located--the Champs Elysees is just a few minutes' walk from there, for example. There is a Metro station not too far, and there are a few other maine boulevards nearby where you can catch a taxi (but the concierge was more than happy to request them so we could be picked up at the front of the hotel). Our room was rather small, but that's to be expected in a boutique hotel. As it was August, the restaurant was only open for breakfast, but that was fine, since we had reservations for dinner while we were in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Classic elegance in Paris with traditional charms.”
Reviews.Author: washbrol
Reviews.Content: The Astor Saint-Honore is an elegant Parisien hotel located in the posh district of the 8th arrondissement, only a few minutes walk to the palace of the French President, the uber-chic (and uber-expensive) shopping street of Fauberg Saint-Honore and the wonderful Champs-Elysees. The style of this hotel is all about classical elegance, and thus very befitting for a stay in Paris. The spacious lobby is backed by a beautiful breakfast room where they serve one of the better breakfast spreads I've had in Paris hotels of similar quality. (though not cheap) The room was unique, with angled walls in the corner looking into the well-kept courtyard and straight across into the hallways and rooms of other guests. For privacy, the thick plush drapes and curtains did the trick with style. Unfortunately, like many hotels of the similar "classical elegance" style, the bed was not incredibly comfortable and the linens not the crispest, softest or newest. But that is something I've come to expect in old historic buildings where bringing the newest mattresses up the stairwells may be distinctly more difficult than in a modern purpose-build business hotel chains. (sometimes an impossibility!) The staff was very professional and it was clear that they were more accustomed to handing a higher-paying guest than the often disgruntled desk-clerks of many small tourist-class hotels in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I could give it a better review...”
Reviews.Author: hrdclck
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from june 28 to july 5, 2009. the concerege was incredibly helpful before and during our stay. the hotel is in a great location, close to shopping, entertainment, a FEW good places to eat and metro stations. the hotel was clean and well furnished. the ONLY problem with this hotel was the air conditioning. once things get cooler and you only need the windows, this is a great place to stay. the rooms could use a little upkeep, patch some holes, ceiling repainted, carpet replaced. we had a standard room and it was very small, and we expected small, like two people will get in each others way. we had our roomed moved due to a/c issue and they put us in a larger room but still hot. the bathroom was much bigger, where you could turn around in it, and because the room was bigger, we were not on top of each other in the heat. i can not say this is a 4 or 5 star hotel based on my stay. i would not discourage someone strongly from staying here but i think you can find same/better and if having a/c is important, this is not the place to stay. business center is only for one person at a time so not a great place for conducting business at all. the room service was pretty decent and 24 hours was nice.

Reviews.Title: “good times”
Reviews.Author: Matt J
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the second half of a london/paris trip. Nice hotel with good rooms that could be great with an update. The location is perfect. Just far enough away from the chaotic tourist areas to be nice and quiet but close enough to the metro that is was easy to get to anywhere. Don't ask the hotel for restaurant advice, do your own research or just find a nice place away from high traffic areas. When we asked we were sent to an overpriced place with mediocre food that DIDN'T SERVE FRENCH WINE!!! My only other advice...stop and have a glass of wine at as many corner cafes as possible. Nothing gets you ready for the next amazing thing paris has to offer better than a nice bordeaux.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great restaurant, and great staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: JosephLeo
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay and would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a central location from which to explore Paris on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: JD1974
Reviews.Content: After a gap of 20 years, we returned to Paris for our 35th wedding anniversary and are very glad we chose this hotel. It's a quiet location and convenient for the metro or if you prefer to walk.Â  The hotel reception and concierge were welcoming and unfailingly helpful, our room was spotless and very comfortable.Â  The breakfast buffet was excellent, all tastes were catered for.Â  We had a fabulous time and it was great to return to the quality and comfort of the Hotel Astor Saint-HonorÃ© each evening.Â  We certainly plan to return.Â

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: H0lidayhead
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 10am with the intention of dropping off our luggage and going off to do some sight-seeing. However, we were delighted when the friendly Reception staff offered to show us to our room immediately, allowing us to freshen up after our early start that morning. This accommodating attitude never faltered throughout our stay. The room was compact, but well decorated and very clean with lovely doors opening onto a quiet and pretty courtyard. Just note that the hotel is in a quiet area of town and it was necessary to provide a full address on the couple of occasions we took taxis (so keep it handy). All in all, it was a calming and relaxing hotel that we looked forward to returning to after a busy day in a bustling city.

Reviews.Title: “Just excellent”
Reviews.Author: greek-traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel April 17th - 21st for our first visit in Paris for more than 20 years. Out of the former reviews we didn't know what to expect, but to us this hotel and its staff were just excellent. The rooms were clean and nice, the service was excellent and location just great for us (we prefer a quiet hotel in a quiet neighbourhood, yet central for walking downtown and for the most important attractions). We also found the breakfast - which was included in our room rate - excellent with a wide variety of both hot and cold dishes. We really didn't feel like leaving - we enjoyed the hotel and Paris so much -, but we made a promise to return before too long.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: VeryPickyLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: We arrived tonight from this hotel and wished we were still there. I read the previous reviews and went to this hotel with mixed feelings. As my name suggests, I am a picky person, who pays attention to details and reading reviews I was expecting a small dinky Parisian hotel. I must confess that this hotel surprised me in a positive way. I will go back to Paris for sure and I will stay at this hotel again. Positives: -The hotel is very nicely decorated. Nothing luxurious but really tasteful and Parisian. - The breakfast was included in our price and was extensive and very nice. I am surprised as other reviews here are not good for breakfast. But believe me this wasn't the case at our stay. The breakfast bar consisted of fresh big crunchy croissants (mmm) and pain au chocolates; fresh cheese selection; fresh fruit; meat cuts; eggs; bread and baked goods; cereals and muesli. We missed the first day breakfast and we had such a hard time finding a good breakfast in the neighbourhood and in touristy area. -Our room was small but not too small (well sized for Paris standards), modern renovated bathroom, well decorated poster bed. Poster bed coverings, wall coverings and the drapes were all matching material in neutral colours. - The staff could very well communicate in English and were nice. -They have a bar on roof top with excellent views, which we unfortunately couldn't find time to have drinks at. - Our room was facing back yard and so quiet to sleep in! Perfect! Negatives: -The mini bar was super expensive and not extensive - Don't even think about the room service as the prices were ridiculous - The location is not in heart of action. You need to walk 5 mins to Metro or 15 mins walk to Champ Elysees. The immediate area is dead at night but by no means dangerous. We walked late night and felt safe. Its a residential high class area but a bit off the path and not in hearth of happening. We didn't mind it much as we like walking.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok if you get a deal”
Reviews.Author: nimanos
Reviews.Content: Nothing special here. The lobby and the other facilities of this hotel are ok. The staff at the reception and the concierge were helpful and they all speak English. Breakfast (hot buffet American types) was ok too but it was on the poor side with just the minimum choices. The room was average, it was clean and the heat was ok though the safe was placed on a shelf which was detached from the wardrobe so I felt it was not that safeâ€¦ The hotel is near two metro stations (of the same line) but we always had to change line so as to get where we wanted to. I got this room at half price (breakfast included) through a deal from octopustravel and I think if the price was the original I wouldnâ€™t think of it at allâ€¦ A just ok choice if you get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad!”
Reviews.Author: katrb
Reviews.Content: Booked this Hotel through Alpha rooms and got it really cheap for 3 nights including breakfast. The rack rate is around Â£300 a nite and if I'd paid that I would have been really disappointed. First the good. Upgraded to a superior room which wasn't that big god helps us if we would have got a standard room. Allowed us an early check in at 12pm Great Location - next to two metro stations and a short walk to the Champs Elysees. Supermarket round the corner Bad Breakfast awful, do not pay â‚¬25 for this. Everything was freezing cold and main desk never manned so always had to wait ages for a table, they looked like they couldn't organise a party in a brewery Room service and bar really expensive Rooms noisy and got stuck in a twin room when we booked a double. Reception hopeless at night. I rang about really really vibrating noise that woke us up during the night. was told someone would come and see. Nothing for over 1 hour then a call asking if we wanted a doctor, when I said no it was a noise they hung up. Then rang back 1 hour later (2am) again asking if we wanted a doctor - you can imagine my response!! Still no resolution to the noise which disappeared around 4am. In summary - if you get it cheap, aren't a light sleeper and don't eat or drink in the Hotel then book it. If not find a nicer Hotel there are lots in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “no regrets”
Reviews.Author: anubis1
