Reviews.Content: I am remiss. We stayedf about 5 years ago when the hotel was a Starwood Hotel.. Quite simply the hotel, room and staff were excellent as is the location. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sait Honore-Paris”
Reviews.Author: Zvig
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the "Astor" and went to the receptionist...they were ready for us...the receptionist escorted us to the room, and asked if we liked our room. With delight I answered "yes". It was a cozy lanvender room...with large windows overlooking the courtyard. This is a boutique hotel, very quite and private.The best part of this hotel is their concierges (Dennis and Alexander). The concierges were very knowlegeable and very helpful. Dennis, the senior concierge, did not hesitate to make reservations for us( walking distance) at a seafood restaurant (Garnier) which was excellent. Also, when he heard that we are going to travel to Nice, he made sure we were staying at one of their hotels (West End) and called the hotel immediately for us to request the best room. He also recommended the best bouabailse (French Seafood Soup) restaurant for us in VilleFranche....It was awsome...the food the ambience, the service....It was a perfect place for our 20th anniversary celebration. All his recommendations were superb....this is what you want from a concierge. Someone who goes out of his way to help recommend excellent places...and is always there to help with any questions....Metro transportations, shopping, and ofcourse food. BRAVO!

Reviews.Title: “Well looked after at the Astor”
Reviews.Author: DaveDeva
Reviews.Content: This was our first return visit to Paris as tourists after 15 years and the Astor Saint Honore was a shot in the dark. My wife and I were impressed with the publicity and location but slightly anxious about some scary web reviews. During our 5 day stay we were delighted with the overall quality of the hotel, the attention from the staff and the food. Yes, the room was compact but we had a quiet courtyard overview on 5th floor and enjoyed the quality of the accommodation. The negative reviews we'd read were very misleading - were they at the same hotel??. We had a great time in Paris, are happy to recommend this hotel and would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Really special hotel”
Reviews.Author: ArchieFC
Reviews.Content: We spent a wonderful weekend at this hotel, celebrating our Ruby Wedding anniversary. We were made to feel special from the moment we arrived. The top floor bedroom had terrific views across to the Eiffel Tower. The room itself, although not enormous, was lovely and the staff were friendly and efficient. The breakfasts were gorgeous. We took the concierge's advice at the where to eat, for a special meal in the evening, on our anniversary,(bearing in mind that lots of restaurants are closed for some of August). It was magnificent and we can't wait to find an excuse to return to Paris and this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A small gem in the heart of everything”
Reviews.Author: jaguar_fletcher
Reviews.Content: This hotel was part of a package trip to France. Our first trip to France and we really enjoyed this small hotel. It is on a narrow side street so not noisy at all. We were in a room facing the inside courtyard. Staff was pleasant. Breakfasts were great!! Good service and fast. The room was small but we didn't spend a lot of time in our room. We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and would use this accommodation again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and location but very over priced”
Reviews.Author: Londonanimal
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in a great location, not far from the Champs Elysee and within easy walking distant of most of Paris. The staff were very helpful and easy to deal with. However, if it weren't for the great Eurostar deal this would not have been worth the money. Whist the hotel is nice the room we were in was a Superior Room, priced at 480 Euros, at current rates that's Â£378 or $746!! It was no way that special, you are definately paying for location rather than style. It was warm weather and the aircon was ineffective, the hotel staff were nice and we tried two other rooms, but all the same. The decor is OK, but a little tired now. We had a nice time because we paid about Â£100/night - but don't pay full price.

Reviews.Title: “Best Concierge in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Doojab
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Paris and we stayed in the Astor for 3 nights. The staff were friendly and attentive, spoke very good English and nothing seemed too much trouble. Dennis, the Concierge, was fantastic; his knowledge of Paris and his ability to obtain a taxi from nowhere was superb. On the downside, we found the room quite small (an 'Astor' room) and we only had a shower. Had we been staying for longer, we would have requested a room change as we do like to have a soak! The shower was good both for power and temperature however, there was nowhere to put your soap or shampoo etc. A small point but annoying none the less! The location seemed perfect for us. Most places just a short walk and a Metro station (St. Augustin) nearby. The location was quiet; we slept with our window open and heard nothing. The buffet breakfast was reasonable though not outstanding. Prices in the bar are not the cheapest. Room service was very fast and the housekeeping staff, friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Bad rooms, badly kept. Disgusting service.”
Reviews.Author: mauriLondon
Reviews.Content: I was looking to find a nice hotel, different from the average where to spend some good time with my wife. After booking through an agent ( 'Superbreak' really, DONâ€™T use this agent if you want to have a good experience), I arrived to the hotel at the entrance I was barely welcomed. Never seen these people before in my life but seemed already very rude. I was given a very, very small room (this was sold as 'luxury'), stains of coffee on the wall, stains on the chairs, broken shower, broken side-table. I asked to be moved, they could only upgrade my staying (for â€˜freeâ€™, I was amazed) to a better room that was more spacious: stains on the 'otherwise-beautiful' chairs, broken wardrobe drawers. In the morning I open the door â€“ my wife wanted to try the room-service: The waiter just walked in, nearly walking over me, my wife just outside the bed looking for the slippers (she was embarrassed). I couldnâ€™t believe it. Not worth it, definitely not worth it. And all this for the modest amount of $300+ a night. After protesting with the manager I was given a free upgrade next time I would have visited the hotel, but unfortunately this hotel and its â€˜crewâ€™ had already ruined my experience in Paris. Astor Saint Honore will never see me again.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: bjspa
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and I chose the hotel because I believed it was close ( a couple of blocks) from the Champs Ã©lysÃ©es and it was, but it was still a walk to the 'good end' at the Arc de Triumph. The room was tiny (even by European standards) and overheated, once we were dressed in the morning we just had to get out because we felt claustrophobic. We tried to figure out how to turn the heater down, but ended opening up the window instead. It was only a double bed which was not that comfortable. The bathroom was a little worn and some brainiac installed the towel rack above the toilet so you had to watch your head. I noticed the safety information sheet on the back of the door that the Astor used to be a Sofitel property, this was a surprise as they are one of my favourite hotel chains and this property did not seem up to Sofitel standards. The American breakfast was great and the dining area was very pleasant. The lobby looked a little tired. There was a complimentary bottle of water on arrival. Denis the concierge is outstanding. Highly knowledgeable and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: Troon22all
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and would definitely stay here again. The staff were, without exception, friendly and helpful. There was a good choice of food at breakfast and the room was clean and adequately sized for 3 people. We stayed in a triple de-luxe room and the bed was huge and extremely comfortable. At first there were a couple of niggles - some of the floor tiles in the bathroom were loose and the roll-away bed for our daughter was placed in front of the wardrobe which made access rather awkward. Also, we were only given towels, cups, glasses, etc., for 2 people, but when the chambermaids knocked on our door early in the evening, we pointed this out and they sorted it out quickly and politely. I only mention this to give an honest view, but the plus points exceeded the minuses. The concierge was knowledgeable and spoke good English, as did most of the staff. Our room was at the back of the hotel, overlooking a courtyard, and was very quiet. I can't comment about rooms at the front, but the area is generally quite quiet. This area isn't in the heart of things, but is only a 20 minute walk from the Louvre and maybe a 10 minute walk from Printemps department store and other shops. There is a small supermarket just around the corner which is useful for water and snacks. I would say that the location is adequate if you are prepared to walk to bus and metro stops. To sum up - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back anytime”
Reviews.Author: Mauger-Collyer
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend in November. We had booked a superior room which we found very confortable even if the bathroom was rather small but very well equipped and furnished. The service was excellent and the concierge was most helpful with finding restaurants nearby because of the transit strike at this time in Paris. On Saturday night they had a special evening in the restaurant Astor which was an 8 course menu de dÃ©gustation with wines included. The meal and the evening was just incredible and we enjoyed this special event which was accompanied by opera singers. An evening with superb food and wine to be remembered. We highly recommend this hotel and we will return on a next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Don't get fooled by the 4-star rating”
Reviews.Author: Phoenix2008
Reviews.Content: I booked my room through the internet and when I arrived at the reception, I had to wait for 30 minutes because their internet connection was not working and they couldn't find my reservation. The rest of the stay was equally disappointing. This hotel pretends to be luxurious but is only above average. The design tries to look impressive but is outdated. It was impossible to reduce the heat in my room so I had to leave the window open. The organization is really weak: on my second day, at 10 a.m. I had to wait for 15 minutes before someone showed up at the reception. True some people at the staff were nice but it all lacks the professionalism you would expect from a 4-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, quiet location in central Paris”
Reviews.Author: Neil111
Reviews.Content: I booked my room through Expedia at the last minute with a significant saving on the typical standard room price. I was pleased with the fairly reasonably sized non-smoking room with queen-size bed I'd requested (being a little cautious about the Expedia warning that such requests might not be honoured by the hotel!). I was shown to my room by one of the reception staff, a hospitable gesture reflecting the level of service at the hotel. The bed linen was spotless and the room was very clean. The bathroom was larger than I'd expected and well stocked with reasonable quality shower gel, etc. A very good first impression. And for the first two nights of my three-night visit my sheets were turned down and chocolates left on my pillow. My room was on the second floor at the rear, overlooking a small courtyard. Since the room was in the middle of the corridor I was expecting noise from other guests. However, although I'm a light sleeper when away from home I encountered no noise whatsover in this quiet spot. The hotel's location is excellent. Ten minutes' walk from the Champs Elysees and even less to Boulevard Hausmann. I don't know Paris very well and I'd never been to the St Augustin area before (the Rue d'Astorg is opposite the imposing St Augustin church and very near the eponymous Metro station) so I was surprised to find myself in the midst of expensive art galleries and upmarket fashion stores. Overall, I was pleased with the quality of the room and the service. The only thing I didn't like was the hotel receptionist's insistence on my providing a cash deposit of â‚¬50 a night. (I don't use a credit card and they wouldn't take a Maestro debit card.) Although it's standard practice in many hotels to request a deposit, I felt a little put out that I was being asked to underwrite my prepaid stay with extra cash. But that's a minor quibble with what was, overall, a very pleasant visit to a good, quiet hotel staffed by curteous, polite people.

Reviews.Title: “amazing breakfast and lovely touches”
Reviews.Author: AndyWildman
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms here. It's a lovely hotel; spotless, attentive service. Fantastic breakfast and elegant public rooms. The breakfast had a wide range of well cooked eggs etc and fresh fruit salad in lovely silverware. There was delicious runny, smelly cheese, brioche and pastries. As usual in Paris you couldn't swing a cat in the bedrooms but the rooms were well appointed, immaculate and comfortable. Shame there was no hospitality tray/kettle. We had the use of fluffy dressing gowns and slippers. From my window I could see Sacre Coeur. Every night the maid came to turn down our bed and bring us a chocolate and the bathrooms are modern and sparkling. The hotel is about 7-10 minutes from the Metro and is in a quiet street.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive”
Reviews.Author: Onnob.
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Astor Saint Honore for a few nights, and although the breakfast was very good, the room wasn't. The airco unit was defect, so we had to keep the windows open for fresh air -introducing kitchen sounds into the room- the bed was uneven and the room was small. The bathroom had a broken floor. The staff was very friendly and professional, the food was fine. We told the hotel about our experience when we left, and received a voucher for a free upgrade the next time we visited. Unfortunately for them, we won't go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Traditional Style Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: penstemon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights at the end of August. It is our second visit to this hotel. We got a very good rate from the internet which included breakfast . We had a superior , non smoking room which overlooked a central courtyard. It was a good size and very nicely decorated with good quality furniture. The bathroom was not big but perfectly adequate with very nice toiletries and fluffy bathrobes. It is extremely quiet around hotel at night as it is on the edge of business district. However it is a 5-6 minute walk to Place de la Madeleine and another 5 to the Opera. Walking in another direction 3-4 minutes brings you to the Elysee Palace on Rue Faubourg St Honore (one of the best shopping streets in Paris) .We always felt safe walking in the area of the hotel at night. Breakfast was expensive at 25 euros per person, although, there was a good selection of all the usual things. Hot things were on offer as well. The only fault at breakfast time was you were served one cup of coffee and refills were not offered without requesting. Then it took time before the waiter came and served it. although coffee was waiting ready. The highlight of a stay in this hotel is the concierge Dennis . He speaks several languages and has an extensive knowledge of Paris and surrounds. He always was more than willing to give suggestions and explain the history of places he suggested for visits. His recommendations for restaurants were excellent.. He did all our bookings for taxis ,shows etc and there were no hitches. We can't praise him enough. The only big complaint we had was with reception on paying our bill. We told the young lady on reception that we wanted to settle our hotel bill in euros ( we had heard about the illegal con trick of converting into your own currency when you pay with your credit card). They are supposed to ask which currency you wish to pay in. We queried it again as it showed both currencies on the slip and were assured that we had been charged in euros not GBP. This was not true as it had been changed into GBP at a rate of 1.37 euros and the rate we got on our credit card for other transactions in Paris was 1.47 euros. We were just glad we had pre-paid our reservation. SO BEWARE when settling your bill. We would definitely stay here again but not charge anything to our room.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed metaphor”
Reviews.Author: schnauzerlady
Reviews.Content: We were a small group (16) that came from throughout the US and arrived at random times. In accordance with the hotel's policies, we were told our rooms might not be available until, at the latest, 3 PM. In many trips to Paris (our son and his wife live there), I've never found it necessary to wait untl the official check-in time to get our rooms; indeed, if we do not get immediate check-in, we are always invited to take breakfast. Not with this hotel. Other parties came in and were shown their rooms; we were told this was because they, with backpacks, had suites that had not been used the previous night. As we did not arrive as a group, one would have thought that rooms would have become avalable throughout the day, based on our arrival times; they did not. Indeed, at 3 PM, there were still no rooms. Our tour leader reminded the hotel of its obligations, and a few rooms opened up, but one couple --about 80 in age and in situ since 10 AM-- did not get their room until 4:30 PM. Our room was acceptable --quiet and of a good size for Paris; the breakfast was outstanding. The front desk was totally disfunctional. We needed to make some phone calls and asked, at the desk, about the cost; when we got the bill, it was 3x what we had been told. On the plus side, MonoPrix is right around the corner. I would have no problem staying again at ths hotel, but I would call ahead and make sure that I could get a room within the appointed time. The location is outstanding; the service is less so.

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned ' three' star instead of 'four'”
Reviews.Author: bbosman
Reviews.Content: Because the concierge was not in (he would be back in 35 min) our car could not be parked. We drove around for half an hour and finally found a parking place. The room was standard instead of superior. A courtyard room with OK facilities and a terrible shower. No pressure on the water and a broken 'shower head' so it was quite an exercise to wash my hair. All together a disappointing experience and we will never go back there with so many nicer options around!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Room in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cdog1216
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a 7 night stay at this hotel during July 4 week. We booked it through Expedia and got a special rate which allowed us to have a Superior Room at a rate which was lower than the Standard Room. The rate was for the room only and did not include breakfast as some other packages mentioned on this site. Room: We read many reviews - most of them on Trip Advisor - and found that the actual room was fairly well described by previous visitors. The size of the room was spacious by European standards. We noticed that our bedspread was badly stained and asked that it be replaced, which was done promptly. The chairs were also badly stained, and there were some stains on the fabric wall coverings. Otherwise the room was pretty clean and comfortable for our needs. The bathroom was larger than we expected, and the shower was always plenty hot. Closet space is very limited, and there was no dresser for clothing. Some things just need to stay in the suitcase if you have a lot of clothng. Service: We asked the concierge for a restaurant recommendation one evening, and he booked us into a very nice place which was walking distance from the hotel. We also observed the 3 different concierges helping other guests throughout the week. All spoke English perfectly and willingly, and all were consistently very polite and helpful. Note that you must ask for wash cloths and extra small towels. They are trying to be conservative with water, etc. so they don't load you up with towels. Location: We couldn't have been happier with the location. We were walking distance from many very nice restaurants/bistros and we particularly enjoyed having breakfast at the St. Augustin Cafe - about a 5 min walk - then walking around the corner to the Metro for our day of walking around the city. We discovered a great neighborhood bistro on Haussman called Pomze, with a great menu, decent prices, fun staff and only a 5 min walk from the hotel. There is also a Monoprix market about 3 minutes walking distance. We went there to stock up on water bottles and snacks. The minibar fridge had plenty of space for our stuff. It was particularly nice to be so close to everything but in a very quiet area. Restaurant: We did not eat in the restaurant, but it looked very nice! One note - when we checked out we discovered that our room had been charged for breakfast every day! We pointed it out to the desk clerk who quickly removed it from the bill. She said that it gets charged automatically! We found this to be surprising, so be sure to study your bill when you check out. Overall, we were very pleased with this hotel and found it to be a very comfortable home base for our trip to Paris. We would recommend it highly for a romantic getaway spot.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: Arkana78
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one week during our honey moon. The hotel was perfectly situated with only a few minutes walk from two metro-stations, 10-15 minutes from the Champs-ElysÃ©es, and Boulevard Haussmann (shopping) is just nearby. The room was an ok size (loved the air condition) and nicely decorated. The hotel was clean, the breakfast good with a good selection and even on the days when we came to eat late there was never an empty plate at the buffet. The mini bar is expensive, but there is a Monoprix just around the corner. The staff were extremely helpful, especially the concierge Denis who knows just about everything, and his restaurant tips were excellent. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the Centre of it all”
Reviews.Author: ChChKiwi
Reviews.Content: Christchurch New Zealand - My wife & I booked this from NZ for a 3 day visit with our daughter & son in law living in London. We wanted within 1 km of the Seine, walking distance to the Batobus, and good quality. We were welcomed by staff speaking much better English than our French, and courteously shown our rooms, ours overlooking the central courtyard and our daughter's over the neighbourhood. Quiet, peaceful, relaxing, bed, bathroom just fine and comfortable, in room safe for security. Only 2 mins walk from the bustle of St Augustines with it's street cafes & Metro, and a 10 min walk down across the Champ's Elysee to the Seine. Next time back in Paris, we will book there again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Birthday in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: IanBl
Reviews.Content: I booked this 3-night break as a special birthday surprise for my Wife, with help/recommendation from my local travel agent. we had the most wonderful stay!The hotel was perfectly situated only 5 mins walk from theChamps-Elysees and some serious designer shops! The hotel was traditional and elegant, with quiet,tasteful and spacious rooms. All staff were friendly and helpful, appreciating my attempts at post-GCE French, but all spoke perfect English! We dined first night in the hotel`s own L`Astor restaurant, which was a true gourmet experience- food and service were really exceptional! We have fallen in love with Paris- what a fabulous city! We will certainly return to this hotel as it surpassed all our expectations- it was just a perfect city break!

Reviews.Title: “3 days in Paris w/Gate 1 Travel”
Reviews.Author: KRayRPh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, as well as friends from LA, spent 3 nights at Hotel Astor St Honore, Paris, in April, as part of a Gate 1 Travel package that included 9 nights on a river cruise from Amsterdam. We experienced a rocky start, in that some of our luggage was detoured by British Airways (we learned this is quite common on flights from London to Paris), but our tour director, Ron Lazet, was relentless in pursuing the stray luggage. The hotel was small, but clean, and well located. The concierge services were exceptionally helpful and prompt. Breakfast, included in our room rate, was ample and healthful each morning. Our balcony view was that of a quaint, well appointed inner courtyard. Ron offered added "walkabouts" each night in various Paris neighborhoods, as he continued daily to pursue our lost luggage. On the 7th night of the Rhine river cruise, Ron reported success in locating our remaining piece of luggage, sending it back to Alabama where it arrived 2 days after we returned home.

Reviews.Title: “Paris at 40”
Reviews.Author: Montmartre40
Reviews.Content: We booked at this hotel after spending many hours searching and using Trip Advisor, but it paid to check everything. I wanted the trip to be special to celebrate my wifeâ€™s 40th Birthday (17th -20th April) in Paris and the hotel certainly played its part. We got a good deal by getting three nights for the price of two and breakfast thrown in. It was worth upgrading to a superior room as we had more space in both our room and en-suite. A helpful tip is that rooms on the 3rd, 5th & 7th floors are non-smoking. We had a room which looked out into the courtyard and despite comments from previous guests found our air-con worked fine. The big fluffy robes were nice to relax in after a long tiring day seeing the sights of Paris. The location was ideal â€“ in a quiet small street but only three minutes walk from a Monoprix (supermarket).There were 2 metros â€“ St.Augustine & Madeleine within easy walking distance which meant you could hop on & get around the city, but it was also easy to walk to Concorde, Tulliers & Champs Elyesees/Arc de Triomphe. The staff were always helpful and courteous, their English extremely good â€“ although we did try and hold as much of our conversations in French as we could. We found that in respecting their language and culture nothing was too much trouble. As a result of explaining the reasons for our visit beforehand, it was a lovely surprise to find a bottle of complementary champagne in our room upon arrival. We found the breakfast each morning to be very good. Despite some comments from other reviews we did not find anything to complain about and also stoked up so that we could go until late afternoon before needing to eat again. The choice was great with anything from cereal & fresh fruit, cold meats, cheese (just donâ€™t expect cheddar as this is France after all) and salad to bacon, scrambled eggs & hash browns to baguettes, brioche to pastries & waffles. All fresh from the kitchen each day. We have since discovered that even the tea (Marriage-Frere) seems to be one of the best you can get. Once again as we found during our stay the key is to simply ask as nothing appeared too much trouble â€“ one guest next to us had freshly made hot chocolate instead of tea. Finally the staff were lovely and made sure everything was how we wanted it. The concierge team and in particular Denis were a real credit to the hotel. They were full of knowledge and tips and took a real interest in making sure our stay at both the hotel and Paris was the best it could be. Despite arriving before check in time, they looked after our luggage whilst we went out to explore and similarly upon checking out, which meant we climbed to the top of the Arc de Triomphe without having to cart our entire luggage around with us. As a final tip, let the staff book a taxi to take you back to the airport, you can then relax and enjoy a final afternoon tea and cake (you must try the pancake cake) in either the bar or Hemmingway room. We would have no problem in recommending this hotel to others and would return in the future to perhaps celebrate another special occasion and rekindle the wonderful memories of our stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovedthis hotel”
Reviews.Author: happytravel7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in July 2006 taking my elderly mother for her first visit to Paris. Good location, Great hotel, rooms were always cleaned well, frequent change of towels, lovely bathrobes. Shower great and there was a good choice at breakfast. We got a great deal through Thomas Cook using our Royal Bank Royalties account. Staff, especially the concierge excellent. Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: plainchoc
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is fantastic, we used the tube several times but also found it incredibly easy to walk to several of the tourist hotspots. We only stayed in Paris for three days and we had a fantastic time, however saying that apart from the location the hotel did not contribute to the great experience we had. The staff are friendly and efficient however the prices are too high, both for the mini bar, hotel bar and the restaurant. The room was too small and just didn't have the small touches which would have made our stay in the hotel so much more welcoming. If you are going for a short break with a partner or friend I don't think you can really beat the location and afterall how much time do you really spend in your hotel when visiting such a great city? I would recommend to stay there but only if you get a good deal, via last minute etc

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: europeantraveler1000
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 9 nights at the beginning of April 2007. We had a wonderful experience, made all the better by the fact that we were able to find a great online deal for this hotel (the 4th and 8th nights were free!) Positives: 1) Nicely maintained structure and rooms. Looks like it's been recently updated and well maintained. The bathrooms were especially nice. 2) Very helpful and friendly staff. The concierge, in particular, was always engaging and seemed eager to help us. 3) Everyone spoke English well. My wife and I tried our best French and if that failed, they were able to converse well with us in English. 4) The location was incredibly convenient, as there was a metro stop about 7 minutes away by foot and a Monoprix (supermarket with great pastries and desserts and cheap beverages) about a 3 minute walk from us. Negatives: 1) Our room was situated overlooking a courtyard, which would become fairly noisy early in the morning. 2) All of the doors in the hotel slam shut, which, I suppose is for security reasons. Unfortunately, once people start waking up in the morning at 6 or 7 AM and leave their rooms, the doors slam shut so hard that they often woke us up. 3) Everything at the hotel is fairly expensive. For example, my wife needed some ice because she injured her foot. We went to the bar and asked for some and were instructed to call room service to obtain the ice. We didn't know, until after, that there's a 5 euro charge just for ice!! 4) The rooms were fairly small, though not unusually so by European standards. Conclusions: The positives far outweighed the negatives for us. We had a wonderful time and would stay here again, assuming we could get a similar rate.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: SunderlandVin
Reviews.Content: this is an excellent hotel in the opera district of paris. the room was of a very high standard and the staff were very friendly and spoke excellent english. the concierge in particular was very helpful and knowledgeable about the area. the hotel is a bit pricey but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: stayingsunny
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights -arriving on the 2nd April. It is in a good situation both for the 'sights' and the shops. We were able to explore on foot.or using the Metro- a metro station being close by. Sadly, we arrived at the hotel minus our luggage. (It failed to appear on the carousel.) However, the concierge - called Denis, couldn't have been more helpful. He was straight on the phone to the airport to try and find out what had happened to it. Unfortunately he had no joy. Next morning he tried again,and again and again...........The luggage failed to materialise but not for want of his trying. As well as trying to sort this out he was also able to recommend eating establishments, issue maps etc. A great help. Breakfast was included in our rate and this provided an excellent start to the day. There was plenty of choice of both hot and cold food and the staff in the restaurant were very polite and helpful. Our room, although not that large ,was very comfortable and overloooked the courtyard making it quiet. Would we go back ? Yes, Would we recommend it ? Yes

Reviews.Title: “ok if cheap rate”
Reviews.Author: gettingaround
Reviews.Content: this hotel was acceptable for the discounted rate available through a broker. Its location is very good. Bathroom was clean enough, burt soft furnishings, bed and breakfast room were tired.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic City, Great Hotel, Good service”
Reviews.Author: buersout
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights at the end of march and had a great time! The hotel is in a good location very close to St Augustin metro station - which is great for getting around the city and close to several main streets for eateries and shopping - e.g. BLvd Malesherbes and Blvd Haussman. The rooms are smallish but not as bad as some may make out - if not slightly larger than average. Beds are really comfortable and bathroom is nice including shower and bath. Bathrobes are an added bonus and turn down service with chocolates! Mini bars are expensive as usual - but nice to have a fridge anyway! Breakfast was included in our rate served btw 7 and 10 and was very good - great selection - lots of juices and drinks, yogurts, cereal, bacon egg and sausage (and hash browns 1 day) bread selection inc. croissants etc and fruit. Very good qualtiy and delicious! Concierge very helpful and staff friendly. Could recommend all types of restaurants. The metro is certainly the best way to see the city - especially due to the hotels location. Get a map and dont be afraid! Its quite easy once you get used to the way it works. Wouldnt bother with the river sightseeing cruise by the Eiffel Tower - we became a little fed up waiting for the english to come on - especially since we didnt know when something of interest was coming up. Porbably better over dinner or of a night. Try going to Place de la Concorde of a night close to the hour - you can see several landmarks lit up including arc de triumphe and eiffel tower - and on the hour the eiffel flashes which is very romantic! Would RECOMMEND for eating the CAFE CAPUCINE on road of same name and LE CARRE at Place de St Augustin. First very reasonable with great food - nothing too outrageous and very friendly service. Later - very haute couture type food - expensive but very nice.

Reviews.Title: “ASTOR LA VISTA”
Reviews.Author: GeordieInParisUnited
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderfull time staying at this hotel for three nights on a mini break to Paris. The hotel was very clean and the staff were very helpfull in every way. The hotel is situated just off the Champs Elysee which is whithin walking distance (5 minutes) and very close to the metro which is very reliable any easy to get around on. We would certainly recommend this hotel and hopefully return to it at a future date.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: sfafasdfasdfas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Astor Saint Honore last november for our honey-moon, and we could not be more pleased. Staff was very friendly and nice. The room could no be cleaner and the breakfast was awsome, lots of diferent options that kept us full for the whole day. Location is great, just a couple minutes from the Saint Augustin metro station, that can take you anywhere in Paris fast and safe. (We advice to buy the metro pass for 5 days, 5 zones, so you don't have to worry about how and when to commute during your stay). Great hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: luvness746
Reviews.Content: The Astor St. Honore is a pretty decent hotel. Room was small which is typical for European standards. However, our room was pretty comfortable. The door opens to the inner courtyard. The only issue we found was with the heater. Apparently, the AC wasn't working, so we just opened the door to let the air in. In regards to location, it was close to the St. Augustin Metro. However, for the price, I would have preferred to be closer to the Champs Elysses. The staff was helpful, especially the concierge. There's a grocery store (Monoprix) and a few brasseries nearby. So, don't bother eating at the hotel. Food there is overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Overly expensive”
Reviews.Author: Autarky71
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the Saint Honore at the end of Jan travellng on Eurostar. On arrival took the metro from Gare du Nord (Magenta station) to St Lazare and had a 10 minute stroll to the hotel. Nice easy transfer. The Hotel itself is located on a very bland side street (no character) though it is very quiet. Checking in was quick, with excellant english being spoken and we were shown to our room by the receptionist. The room itself was on the first floor, was a nice size, very clean, mini bar, wardrobe, small safe, small tv with english speaking news channels, writing desk. All pretty standard stuff. The bathroom however was very small and an awkward shape. The room was too small for a bath though the large shower was excellant and the fittings were quality. The only problems were the bed which seemed small and the heat. Even in Jan the room was roasting at night and being jan the a/c wasn't on. Our windows (doors) lead out to the patio area so wasn't keen on leaving them open at night. The hotel has a nice intimate bar and the concierge was most helpful in making dinner reservations. The breakfast which was included in our deal was in my opinion very poor. Various pastries, cold cuts and a cooked selection. The pastries were good according to my partner but the cooked option (buffet style) was very poor and the cheeses were like rubber. I certainly would not pay to have breakfast at the hotel. As for its location... less than 5 minutes walk to the nearest metro (Saint Augustin) and the Madeline, Opera, the Louvre and even the Champs elyses all with in easy walking distance. Recomendations - Don't worry too much about location in Paris. If your staying anywhere central you can walk to most attractions and the metro is excellant if its too far or you don't want to walk. We purchased the 10 ticket option on the metro and that worked perfectly. Also went on the open top bus. Usual hop on hop off stlye with 4 routes. Was 28 euros for two days travel (think its 24 or 25 euros for one day) So thought the 2 day option good value, and gave excellant views around Paris. Drinks are expensive so did as another reviewer recommended and went to the supermarket (monoprix) and bought some beers and cokes for the room and put them in the mini bar. Think 6 or 7 euros for a bottle of beer in the bar compared to 3 euros for 6 cans from the supermarket. Food was a bit hit and miss. Over 100 euros in a Brasserie (Le Boeuf sur le toit) for 2 courses with a bottle of wine. Much cheaper went we walked down to the Hard Rock cafe - touristy perhaps but very good. But there are restaurants, bars and cafes everywhere. Finally though there was nothing wrong with the hotel,but I would be looking to stay elsewhere (cheaper) next time. There were loads of decent looking hotels in the area. I don't need a hotel bar or restaurant, would rather save some money and spent it out and about exploring paris, which was by the way fantasic. We did the usual - top of the eiffel tower (fantasic), the Lourve, Notre Dame, Basilique du Sacre-Coeur etc. All off which was good. Enjoy !

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure”
Reviews.Author: BartsBoss
Reviews.Content: This is a short review to let my fellow travelers know how much we enjoyed staying at your hotel. The personnel were all outstanding--especially the head concierge, Denis, who gave us superb assistance and guidance during our entire stay. The entire staff was very knowledgeable and helpful and made our stay in Paris memorable. Your hotel is a very special one and I will share this new find with my associates. I look forward to seeing you all again.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: WandererCardiff
Reviews.Content: Stayed here three nights for my surprise 60th birthday weekend. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly; check-in, concierge, porters, maids, et al. The room was a little on the small side but bathroom very clean and well-equipped though bath quite small. The bed was very comfortable. We overlooked a tiny courtyard which meant it was quiet though the street itself was not busy. Breakfast was excellent with a good choice of fresh fruit, cooked items, cereals, patisseries and fresh juices. The Astor is five minutes from La Madeleine and a few minutes more from Place de la Concorde so was well placed for transport, shops and getting to major sights. Plenty of small, reasonable restaurants in the area. Make sure you take the open topped bus to start things off. Would stay here again but probably ask for a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “NIce but not as nice as expected”
Reviews.Author: hunnybee
Reviews.Content: I have just arrived back from paris yeaterday i stayed at the astor st honore first of all, when you walk in the reception it is lovely but i have to say the room was a bit of a let down it was very small with no view,on the other hand the bathroom was very modern which was nice and body lotion and body wash was provided! The room service was nice didn't go much on the breakfast bacon sausages and scrambled eggs (cold). But this was a buffet breakfast included in the price of the room. I have also just found out that i have been charged twice for my room service as they took my credit card details when i arrived. I have not yet got it sorted. Over all a very nice hotel would stay again as the location is great a 2 minute walk to the metro the only let down was the room.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: NatashaVV
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my mother from the 4/12 to the 8/12. I found the service at this establishment to be quite appalling. When we arrived at the hotel we used the shower before venturing out. To our surprise the drain was blocked and the water was running all over the floor and we were therefore unable to use it. We reported it and then went out. When we returned at midnight there was a note on our door with no apology saying that we had to move rooms immediately. The new room was not much better with lighting that didn't work and inadequate bedding. All in all not a very enjoyable experience. We were also charged â‚¬30 for two tickets by the concierge for tickets to the Louvre which were only â‚¬17 to buy at the museum.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Exceptional
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our vacation in Paris. We had a wonderful time and due in part to our hotel that we stayed at in Paris. This hotel was everything that we expected and more. Before I travel, I always do a lot of research to determine best places to travel, stay, eat; I took the time to read numerous reviews on trip advisor to determine what hotel in Paris to stay in. This was our 2nd trip to Paris, and I wanted to stay in a very nice hotel. Not only did this hotel exceed our expectations, but the staff was always friendly & helpful. When we arrived, we received an upgrade from a Classic room to a Deluxe room, which was very nice. I would highly recommend this hotel, and look forward to staying there again when I return to Paris. This hotel was very clean, had excellent service, the staff provided great recommendations, and the concierge service was top notch. I am extremely picky when it comes to hotel rooms, and I must say that I was not disappointed. As the saying goes, you pay for what you get, and although this hotel may be a bit pricey, it was well worth it. Seattle, WA

Reviews.Title: “a little gem”
Reviews.Author: atlantic-traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel located in a side street between the Champs ElysÃ©es and the Opera. Rooms at this hotel do seem to be smaller than experienced at some other properties, so if this will be an issue then you either need to upgrade room category or go someplace else. Rooms are decorated in a traditional style, and perhaps slightly dated, but very clean and well maintained. The compact bathroom was spotless. The buffet breakfast served in the spacious restaurant was excellent and an excellent start to the busy day ahead. A brisk walk to the Champs ElysÃ©es takes about twenty minutes through the attractive government quarter. You can also walk to the famous Paris department stores Au Printemps and Galeries Lafayette in about the same time. An intimate hotel, which seemed to offer unpretentious quality.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT DEAL”
Reviews.Author: maxfunds
Reviews.Content: The Astor was a pleasant surprise because there were NO UNPLEASANT SURPRISES. We had one of the smaller, darker rooms but were still happy with the experience, if that says anything. The staff is pleasant. The location cannot be beat. It's quiet and not on a busy street, but the hotel is near EVERYTHING you'd want to see and experience, including great restaurants and the incredible, high-end shopping of the Rue Faubourg St. Honore. The hotel has a nice, small, private bar with great drinks and service. But the skip the very expensive buffett breakfast. Grab a baguette and some nutella and cheese. There are groceries nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: SJE1000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Astor Saint-Honore for two nights during September 2006. Upon arrival at the hotel we were greeted by a friendly member of staff who checked us in and showed us to our room. We had booked a standard room, which was a really good size and was spotlessly clean and very well equipped. It had french windows and a smallish balcony overlooking a courtyard area. The bathroom was newly fitted and offered complimentary toiletries and use of bathrobes. The hotel itself is situated down a quiet street, and is about a 7 minute walk from the nearest metro station. The surrounding area has a few restaurants and bars. The hotel restaurant is not open over the weekend, so we couldn't eat there in the evening, however we took breakfast on both mornings and the choice and quality was excellent, including a cold and hot buffet, consisting of scrambled egg, sausage, bacon, etc. The hotel has a small bar which appears to be very popular, we had drinks there on both evenings and the bar person was extremely helpful and friendly supplying our beverages until the early hours! Overall, this is a fantastic hotel. Although it is a little on the expensive side, we booked via airmiles, making our staff very reasonable. It does feel a little bit out of the way of the true tourist sights, but the standard and service of the hotel makes up for this. I would not hesitate in returning there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: reviewer26
Reviews.Content: I spent a week while on business and loved it. My room was on the 5th floor and was enormous by Paris standards. The decor is beautiful. Most of all, the staff could not be more helpful. I really enjoyed my stay here. My only qualm was the location - it can be a bit lonely at night and there are that many restaurants around. Overall though, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: TheDurangoKid
Reviews.Content: Beautifully decorated rooms with comfortable queen sized beds in a great location. The staff was helpful and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: jacadi
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter [15] & I stayed at the Astor from Aug.23 - Sept.3. Ten days in one hotel usually makes for problems, not at the Astor. The rooms [junior suite] were immaculate, comfortable, private with a huge terrace to enjoy the Paris evenings. The service staff were polite, responsive & helpful, espesially the men at the concierge desk. Breakfast was included from a buffet of most everything you would want & if it wasn't, you could order from the kitchen [included]. Location is great with easy access to restaurants, shopping [help!], public transit & all the sites. We had a slight problem with the ensuite safe which was attended to & corrected within 10 minutes of our call. We would highly recommend the Astor.

Reviews.Title: “Parisian, romantic, cozy..”
Reviews.Author: Surfacing1982
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband spent two nights in Astor Saint-HonorÃ© during our honeymoon in mid May 2006. We both enjoyed the hotel very much. We stayed in a Classic Room (the cheapest one) which was cozy and romantic, but best of all was the service. The hotel staff is very friendly and attentive. They are very knowledgeable about the city and give you good suggestions on something new to do whether youâ€™re familiar with the city or visiting it for the first time. Hotel Astor is at a good location too, itâ€™s not that far from Champs-ElysÃ©es, you could comfortably walk there with your trainers except that I was wearing new heals and they were killing me by the time we got there. Overall weâ€™re both very happy to have had this stay as a part of our honeymoon experience.

Reviews.Title: “August 2006”
Reviews.Author: fullcircle360
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel and there was some confusion over the room our travel agent booked for us. The staff at the hotel (Lesley)resolved the problem within minutes and upgraded us to a suitable room. The staff were more than helpful, very polite and made the language barrier easy due to their fluent English. The morning breakfast buffet was superb. The hotel was in an ideal location, within minutes walk to the St Augustin metro.We found Paris surprisingly small once we got to know our way around. Most places of interest were within reasonable walking distance of each other. Although the Hop on bus tour is recommended if you want to see all the attractions without having to walk to far. We recommend everything Paris has to offer, but the Louvre was great.However the waiting times to get in were inexcess of half hour. this could have been attributed to entry being FREE on the first sunday of each month. Hope this is useful and you enjoy your next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hertfordshiremember
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this Hotel for five nights recently (late July) and in our view and experience, this is an excellent 4 Star Hotel. The location is very convenient. The Metro StationSt Augustin is only a few hundred yards from the Hotel. The SNCF Railway Station St Lazarre (eg to visit Monet's House, Garden and Tomb in Giverny) is less than a ten minutes walk. The Louvre, Tuileries and Champs Elysees are all within walking distance. All the Hotel Staff we had contact with (Reception, waiters, Chambermaids, Concierge etc) were friendly, helpful and efficient and had no difficulty in communicating in English; only the girl in Laundry had to ask the front desk for help interpret. Our Room (715) on the seventh Floor was not very large but it had a magnificient view of the Eiffel Tower; a wonderful sight when fully lit up at night. The buffet breakfast was was perfectly adequate with a choice of hot and cold fare though perhaps the choices were not quite as lavish as say in some Five Star Hotels. There are several eating places nearby. For Italian food, Cafe Michel Angelo in Boulevard Haussman is only a few hundred yards from the Hotel, and is superb; the proprietor and staff are all friendly and the meals delicious; the portions are also generous. Try their Special Salads ! There is a branch of the supermarket chain Monoprix also within a few hundred yards from the Hotel, in the corner of Rue d'Astorg and Boulevard Malesherbes, which sells mineral water, groceries, sandwiches etc.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful and totally unexpected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent the weekend of my birthday at the hotel. Very central and easy to find from the train station (Gar Du Nord). We stayed in the de luxe suite and it was well worth the money. The staff were very heopful, friendly and best of all spoke English. My only gripe was breakfast, we decided to pass as we paid in excess of Â£400 for the weekend and would have expected breakfast to be included, it was 30 euros per person. There are a world of shops, stores, boutiques in this very up market area. The public transport was fab as well, above and beyond Londons public transport, which is where i am from. All in all we had a fab weekend and would recomend this hotel for a romantic get away

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous find”
Reviews.Author: Fijura
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this hotel last week on business for 4 days. Thought the rooms were fabuous, very well equipped. The main areas of the hotel were absolutely stunning, beautifully decorated and a wonderful attention to detail. The staff couldn't be more helpful / especially with my very poor French! What a hidden treasure this hotel is, location was fabulous, central and good transport links.
